description.narrative: Liquid Telecommunications (Jersey) Limited (the Company or Liquid) is a leading pan-African technology group with operations across 15 countries, primarily in Sub-Saharan Africa. Liquid has firmly established itself as the leading provider of pan-African digital infrastructure with an extensive network covering approximately 100,000 km. Liquid is redefining network, cloud, and cybersecurity offerings through strategic partnerships with leading global players, innovative business applications, smart cloud services and world-class security on the African continent. The Group also operates data centres in Johannesburg, Cape Town, Nairobi, Harare and Kigali, with a combined potential 19,000 square metres of rack space and 74 MW of power. The transaction comprises of a US$90 million equity investment to help company expand its data centre business. The investment would enable the Company to undertake its planned capital expenditure program over next few years to continue be the leading player supporting the digitization of Africa.

The Project is expected to increase access to data center capacity for businesses in regional hubs like South Africa, Kenya, Nigeria and Egypt, along with countries with larger gaps such as the DRC and South Sudan, that are digitally connected to these hubs. This has the potential to enable increased availability of quality digital services for individuals and enhanced productivity growth for businesses, recognizing some potential for increased GHG emissions. Beyond the Project, the investment is expected to strengthen integration of the African economy by enabling a faster growth of cloud computing services through expansion of data infrastructure.

name.narrative: The Project involves expansion of the Companys data center operations across the African continent, including in South Africa, Kenya, Nigeria, and Egypt.
